span.style: font-family: Arial; font-size: 11pt; font-weight: bold; color: #003366; line-height: 1.25;

div.span: The Southeast Delco Board of Directors, in conjunction with the Delaware County Intermediate Unit (DCIU) Search Consultants, are conducting the search for the next Superintendent of Schools for the Southeast Delco School District. Information and updates can be found here and on the DCIU website: www.dciu.org.
For the position posting and to apply, please click Here! Please check back regularly for information and updates.

div.span: Southeast Delco School District is making available a student accident insurance policy that is underwritten by
United States Fire Insurance Company. This policy is offered on an optional basis for all students during the 2019 / 2020 school year.

span.div: Please click below for coverage, cost and enrollment information.

a.title: Go to comments for K-12 Student Accident Insurance

span.style: font-family: Arial; font-size: 11pt; font-weight: bold; color: #003366;

div.span: CHIP provides coverage for uninsured kids and teens up to age 19 in Pennsylvania.

span.div: CHIP covers routine checkups, prescriptions, hospitalization, dental, eye care, and more. Most kids receive CHIP for free. Others can get the same benefits at a low cost.

p.span: Attention All Residents
Please read the Saturday, April 25 COVID-19 update for Southeast Delco in its entirety.

Laptops and Chromebooks will be distributed starting this Monday, April 27. Parents and guardians must pick up their devices at their child’s home school and must present valid identification in order to receive district property. The schedule for distribution is as follows:
On Monday, April 27, Academy Park High School students can pick up devices at Academy Park High School from 10 am to 2 pm.
On Tuesday, April 28, students from Harris School and Sharon Hill School can pick up devices at their schools. Pick up time for both schools is 10 am to 2 pm.
On Wednesday, April 29, students from Darby Township School and Delcroft School can pick up devices at their schools. Pick up time for both schools is 10 am to 2 pm.
On Thursday, April 30, students from the Kindergarten Center can pick up their devices at the Kindergarten Center between 10 am and 2 pm.
Friday will be a make-up day for families who were unable to pick up devices on the date designated for their child's home school. The make-up schedule on Friday, May 1 is as follows:
From 9:00 am to 11:00 am, the Kindergarten Center and Darby Township School will be open for families who were not able to pick up devices earlier in the week.
From 11:30 am to 1:30 pm, Delcroft School and Sharon Hill School will be open for families who were not able to pick up devices earlier in the week.
From 2:00 pm to 4:00 pm, Harris School and Academy Park High School will be open for families who were not able to pick up devices earlier in the week.
Food bundles will continue to be available for pickup at four district locations.
Attention All Parents / Guardians
Online Instruction for Students
There have been many questions concerning online learning and technology distribution. To receieve a laptop or Chromebook,
you must

complete either the phone survey or the survey on the district website about access to technology. (The link to the district online survey is available below this artice.) This is what will help determine who receives a computer from the district.

The district will also be offer alternative, hard copy activities for families who prefer those to online learning. Students in specialized classes may continue to receive individualized learning packets specific to their needs.
Thank you for your continued patience and your dedication to keeping the community safe.

span.a: Click here for Online Learning Technology Survey
Southeast Delco Continuity of Education Plan

p.span: This message is specifically for district staff. Please read this entire announcement concerning the closure of all schools in the Southeast Delco School District. Governor Wolf has mandated the closure of all K-12 schools across Pennsylvania for the remainder of the school year. This means that all Southeast Delco Schools and offices will be closed from Saturday, March 14, 2020 until Friday, June 12, 2020.

All district employees are to remain home during this period. Professional staff will receive information on instruction as plans are finalized. All other staff are not being asked to perform any of their duties at this time, though there may be requests for voluntary assistance going forward.
Plans for educational opportunities, food services, business continuity, and other critical items continue and will be shared with staff and community as they evolve.
Please check your email regularly. As always, all future updates will be made via our global messaging system, our website and our TV station.
Thank you for working with us through this turbulent time.

span.style: line-height: 1.25; font-family: Arial; font-size: medium; color: midnightblue;

h2.span: The mission of the Southeast Delco School District is to nurture, educate, and challenge students to become lifelong learners, possessing knowledge, compassion, and a desire to serve the global community.
